business.headline: What to expect from the National Stock Exchange in the next 5 years?Ashish Chauhan, CEO of NSE Chauhan, said the rise in investors and market size over the last decade gives a clear idea of the potential ahead. In 2014, India had just 1.67 crore unique investors. Today, there are about 12 crore investors.

50% tariffs and growth: Why India must focus on reform, not retaliationAt the India Today Conclave Mumbai 2025, experts called for reforms, investment-led growth, and targeted support for vulnerable sectors to navigate challenges from steep US tariffs.

Explained: Why Dalal Street has an edge over global stock marketsAt the India Today Conclave in Mumbai, Ashish Chauhan, CEO of the National Stock Exchange of India (NSE), explained why India's markets and economy hold a stronger position for the future compared to others.

From 50% tariffs to growth: Why India needs reforms, not retaliationAs the US slaps steep tariffs on Indian goods, the debate is shifting from retaliation to reform. Experts at the India Today Conclave Mumbai 2025 say India should use this moment to push for deeper reforms that fuel investment and boost domestic demand.
How to invest in pharma and IT stocks during current slowdownWith the US announcing fresh tariffs on branded drugs and uncertainty around H-1B visa rules, both sectors are experiencing headwinds.

India-US trade talks advance amid tariff and energy discussionsIndia-US trade discussions are gaining momentum, with both nations exploring ways to enhance economic cooperation, address tariffs, and boost energy trade.

Sensex tumbles 733 points as pharma, IT stocks hitThe sell-off came after the United States announced a steep 100% tariff on imports of branded and patented pharmaceutical products, effective October 1.

Indian air passengers rise to 131.7 lakh in August 2025 amid rising costs: ReportIndia's aviation sector is bouncing back, but the journey isn't without turbulence. Rising fuel costs, operational challenges, and financial pressures are testing airlines, even as passenger traffic shows steady growth.

Sensex tanks 800 points: Why is stock market falling today?By 2:37 pm, the S&P BSE Sensex had lost 782.71 points to trade at 80,376.97, while the NSE Nifty50 slipped 247.10 points to 24,643.75. Both indices were on track to end the week in negative territory.

Investors brace for IPO wave as 18 public listings hit Dalal Street next weekThe four mainboard IPOs opening next week together aim to raise over Rs 850 crore. Apart from them, 14 SME IPOs will also open for bidding next week.

Why more insurance policyholders are turning to private grievance platformsAs claim rejections soar and official channels frustrate, policyholders turn to private grievance platforms. Experts warn regulatory reform and competent brokers could restore trust in India's struggling insurance system.

From EMIs to assets: How home loans are creating India's new wealth generationIn India, home loans are doing more than financing houses—they are quietly shaping the country's next generation of wealth. Every EMI paid is becoming a step toward financial growth and stability.

Crypto in slump. 3 reasons why Bitcoin, Ethereum and Dogecoin are strugglingThe cryptocurrency market is struggling, and major tokens are taking the hit. Bitcoin, Ethereum, and Dogecoin have all dropped as investors react to a mix of macroeconomic uncertainty, liquidations, and upcoming market events.

EPFO 3.0 roll-out likely delayed, ATM withdrawals pushed to 2026The wait for EPFO 3.0 just got longer. While the update is set to make provident fund services more seamless, its highlight feature, ATM withdrawals, is now likely to come into effect in 2026.

Why Trump's MAGA is impossible without Indian CEOsThe list of Indian-origin CEOs in global technology and beyond is long and growing. Satya Nadella leads Microsoft, Sundar Pichai is at Alphabet and Google, Arvind Krishna heads IBM, Shantanu Narayen runs Adobe, and Neal Mohan was appointed YouTube CEO in 2023.

Trump slaps 100% tariff on branded pharma drug imports: Should India worry?For now, experts say that India's generic drug exports remain largely safe, though any future extension of US tariffs to generics could disrupt the sector and investor sentiment.
Dalal Street outlook: Is market entering a consolidation phase?

Cipla, Dr. Reddy's, Sun Pharma: Why pharma stocks are falling todayAt 9:39 am, Sun Pharma fell 2.94% to Rs 1,548, Cipla dropped 1.92% to Rs 1,475, and Dr. Reddy's Laboratories slipped 1.17% to Rs 1,275. The sector's decline added to the broader weakness in equity markets.

Pharma stocks drag stock markets lower after Trump's 100% drug tariff threatAt 9:24 am, the S&P BSE Sensex was down 240.39 points at 80,919.29, while the NSE Nifty50 slipped 86.30 points to 24,804.55. Broader market indices also mirrored the weakness.

Exclusive: Adani set to acquire Sahara's crown jewel assets in landmark dealThe deal stems from a long-running dispute ongoing before the Supreme Court led by the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi) against key Sahara entities, requiring them to refund investor money.

Ananya Birla on building Swatantra, making music, and leading with valuesWhether running businesses, writing songs, or leading teams, Ananya Birla believes in giving her all. Speaking at the India Today Conclave Mumbai 2025, she reflected on her early start, her discipline, and the values that guide her.

Ananya Birla on balancing business, music, and leadershipAnanya Birla wears many hats - entrepreneur, musician, and leader. At the India Today Conclave Mumbai 2025, she shared how discipline, values, and passion have helped her navigate each role with purpose.

CBDT extends deadline for filing income tax audit reports to October 31CBDT said the move comes in response to representations from professional bodies, including Chartered Accountant associations, highlighting difficulties in completing audit reports on time.

Sensex tumbles over 500 points, Nifty falls below 25,000The Nifty 50 slipped 0.66% to 24,890.85, while the BSE Sensex eased 0.68% to 81,159.68, logging their longest losing run since early March. Over the past five sessions, the Nifty and Sensex have fallen 2.1% and 2.2%, respectively.

Stock market investing: Can AI really beat human experts?At the India Today Conclave Mumbai 2025, experts discussed how AI is changing stock market investing, whether it can replace traditional methods, and what role human judgement will continue to play.

How not to lose money on the stock market? Experts answer at India Today ConclaveWith increasing participation in equities, especially after the strong returns of the past few years, experts mentioned the importance of patience, asset allocation and realistic expectations.

World's second-richest man pledges to give away 95% of his $373 billion fortuneMuch of his philanthropy is channelled through the Ellison Institute of Technology (EIT), a for-profit organisation based at the University of Oxford. EIT works on global challenges such as healthcare, climate change, food insecurity, and AI research.

Where are Indians heading this festive season? Top destinations revealedCurious where Indians are planning to travel this festive season? From bustling international cities to iconic domestic spots, these are the destinations topping the list.

Festive gold rush: Should you buy jewellery or gold stocks this season?Indians love buying gold, especially in the festive season. However, Dalal Street has also seen an upward trend, with positive domestic developments such as GST rate cuts and income tax reforms earlier in the year.

Court questions Priya Kapur's plea to disclose Sunjay Kapur assets in sealed coverThe application was filed in the ongoing inheritance dispute involving Karisma Kapoor's children, who are claiming a share in their late father's personal assets.
Gold slips from record high. 3 factors explainedGold retreated from its record peak this week, leaving investors curious about what triggered the fall. Here are three key factors behind the dip.

Insurance complaints surge 45% in Q2 as health policies drive cases: ReportRising disputes reveal persistent mis-selling and transparency gaps in India's insurance sector, with policyholders increasingly turning to platforms like Insurance Samadhan to assert rights and seek timely redressal.

Missed the ITR deadline? You will now have to file under new tax regimeWondering what happens if you miss the ITR filing deadline? Did you know you'll automatically be shifted to the new tax regime, losing the option to choose the old one?

Which are the best sectors to invest on Dalal Street right now? Check best picksFrom FMCG to NBFCs, railways, autos and even shipbuilders, analysts see opportunities across a range of sectors as Dalal Street faces volatility.

Sensex, Nifty trade flat after opening lower amid F&O expiry, US visa curbsAt 9:28 am, the S&P BSE Sensex was up 95.55 points at 81,811.18, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 25.65 points to 25,082.55. Broader market indices also traded in the green, though overall sentiment on Dalal Street remained mixed.

Atlanta Electricals IPO allotment out: Check your status, listing date and GMPInvestors who applied for Atlanta Electricals IPO can check their allotment status through either the BSE website or the registrar's platform, MUFG Intime India Private Limited.

Government imposes import curbs on plain silver jewellery till March 2026The restrictions have been introduced in the wake of an import of plain silver jewellery from under preferential duty exemptions rising steeply during April-June 2024-25 to April-June 2025-26.
Should investors be cautious of IT stocks amid H-1B visa changes?With ongoing changes in visa fees and policies, analysts say the outlook for the sector has turned uncertain in the short run.

How NPCI powers half the world's digital payments on just Rs 500 croreNational Payments Corporation of India handles 46% of the world's digital transactions. UPI alone processes 3,729 transactions per second.

Cabinet clears Rs 1,866 crore productivity bonus for railway staffRailway employees are in for festive cheer as the Union Cabinet has approved a productivity-linked bonus, benefiting lakhs of staff members.

entertainment.headline: Rani Mukerji reacts to wearing daughter Adira initials to National Film Awards Rani Mukerji shared the heartfelt reason behind the customised necklace bearing her daughter's initials at the National Film Awards, symbolising her daughter's presence on her special day. She also spoke about women's freedom to choose their paths in a male-dominated industry during the India Today Conclave Mumbai 2025.

Rahul-Tina are still relevant: Rani Mukerji cherishes National Award-win with SRK Actor Rani Mukerji appeared at India Today Conclave Mumbai 2025 for the session titled, 'Queen of Reinvention: National Award to Motherhood, Winning it All'. She shared her Rahul Tina moment at the National Award and also spoke about her character in 'Mrs. Chatterjee vs Norway'.
Backstage Siblings: From living room jams to sold-out shows Backstage Siblings, India's first jamming band by siblings Raghav and Prachi, performed on Day 2 of India Today Conclave Mumbai 2025.

Rani Mukerji says her father was heartbroken on National Award snub for Black Actor Rani Mukerji spoke at India Today Conclave Mumbai 2025. She recalled the time when her father was heartbroken over her not winning a National Award for Sanjay Leela Bhansali's 'Black'.

Rani Mukerji on 30 years of movies, faith, patience and her 1st National Award Rani Mukerji opens up on her first National Award win for 'Mrs. Chatterjee vs Norway', sharing her 30-year journey, memories of her late father, and the joy of winning alongside Shah Rukh Khan at India Today Conclave 2025.

Suriya and Jyotika's daughter makes directorial debut with Leading Light Diya Suriya, daughter of Tamil actors Suriya and Jyotika, has made her directorial debut with the docu-drama short 'Leading Light'. The film has gained recognition with an Oscar Qualifying Run at Los Angeles' Regency Theatre.

Min Yoongi Treatment Center by BTS' Suga moves fans with personal touch BTS' SUGA launches Min Yoongi Treatment Center in Seoul in partnership with Severance Hospital. Facility adopts MIND programme to help children and young adults on the autism spectrum.

Bobby Deol says his family feared him during his alcoholism, been sober over a year Actor Bobby Deol spoke about his struggle with alcoholism during a difficult phase of his career, expressing regret over the fear his family experienced during the time.

Aryan Khan's The Ba***ds of Bollywood season 2 in the works, confirms Rajat Bedi Actor Rajat Bedi has confirmed that 'The Ba***ds of Bollywood' will return for a second season. The show marked Aryan Khan's directorial debut and received positive reviews from critics and audiences alike.

Saif Ali Khan recalls near-fatal knife attack: Walking away unscathed is miraculous Bollywood actor Saif Ali Khan survived a terrifying knife attack at his Mumbai home earlier this year. Describing his escape as miraculous, he talks of how he fought off the intruder despite a severe injury. He is now recovering while preparing for upcoming film projects.

Thamma trailer: Ayushmann, Rashmika promise folklore, fear and fun this Diwali Ayushmann Khurrana plays a vampire of sorts in 'Thamma', produced by Dinesh Vijan's Maddock Films. The film is a part of the Indian horror-comedy universe, and also features Rashmika Mandanna and Nawazuddin Siddiqui in lead roles.

Cinema and the big AI question: Can machines make movies with heart? As Sunny Leone's AI-driven film 'Kaur or Kore' leads the way in AI storytelling, we discuss whether Artificial Intelligence revolutionises filmmaking or kills creativity. IndiaToday.in speaks to the industry experts on the future, fears and legal battles of AI in cinema.

The Ba***ds of Bollywood feels like one big party with no plot to go home to Aryan Khan's debut series attempts to reveal Bollywood's underbelly including nepotism and scandals. The show's chaotic narrative and overplayed themes sparked mixed reactions among viewers.

Boney Kapoor says ex-wife Mona Shourie bought his and Sridevi's wedding rings Boney Kapoor discusses the challenges of balancing two families and the effect on his children. Kapoor reveals his first wife Mona Shourie Kapoor bought the wedding rings for both him and Sridevi.

12th Fail is the plot twist no one anticipated for Vikrant Massey and Bollywood '12th Fail', which was a sleeper hit at the time of its release, won big at the 71st National Awards. The film not only won an award in the Best Feature Film category, but also got Vikrant Massey recognition for his acting performance.

Dinesh Yadav recalls when Jaya Bachchan beat him with stick on Bhojpuri film set Actor Dinesh Lal Yadav revealed how Jaya Bachchan actually hit him with a stick during a film shoot. The incident happened on the set of Bhojpuri film 'Ganga Devi' (2012).
Sohum Shah's Tumbbad 2 to go on floors next year Sohum Shah Films has partnered with Pen Studios to produce 'Tumbbad 2', the sequel to the acclaimed 2018 film.

Chocolate boy to chameleon: Choi Woo-shik's evolving screen journey In this week's K-fix, we discover how Choi Woo-shik, South Korea's Chocolate Boy, redefined versatility with standout roles in 'Parasite', 'Our Beloved Summer', 'The Witch' and more.

It's like having a daughter: Nagarjuna on his bond with daughter-in-law Sobhita Actor Nagarjuna expressed heartfelt admiration for his daughter-in-law Sobhita Dhulipala, highlighting their warm bond and shared interests since her marriage to Naga Chaitanya. The couple's intimate wedding took place in Hyderabad last year.

general news.headline: Absurd theatrics: India slams Pak PM Shehbaz Sharif at UN over his speechIndia sharply rebuked Pakistan at the UN after PM Shehbaz Sharif reiterated Islamabad's stance on Kashmir during his address to the General Debate of the 80th UNGA.

Elon Musk, Trump ally Steve Bannon among fresh names in 3rd batch of Epstein FilesHouse Oversight Committee documents show late sex offender Jeffrey Epstein maintained ties with Elon Musk, Peter Thiel, and Steve Bannon after his 2007 plea deal, releasing 8,544 files amid partisan disputes.

India get a wake-up call, need a Super Over to shake off Sri LankaAsia Cup 2025, IND vs SL: India extended their winning run in Dubai, but they were tested by Sri Lanka in their final Super 4 match. Pathum Nissanka's 107 went in vain as Sri Lanka tied with India before losing the Super Over on Friday, September 26.

Empty chairs greet Netanyahu at UN as diplomats walk out of his speechScores of diplomats walked out of the UN General Assembly as Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu addressed the session, protesting Israel's war in Gaza. Netanyahu vowed to "finish the job" and said his speech was broadcast across Gaza to pressure Hamas.

Is Siddu trying to guilt trip Azim Premji with a sleight of hand?Wipro founder Azim Premji courteously refused Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah's request to open a road on the company's campus for public vehicles to ease traffic congestion. Is Siddaramiah trying to transfer guilt on Bengaluru's traffic nightmare? Is Premji right in rejecting the request?

Couples duped, poor women exploited as ED unravels Hyderabad surrogacy racketCouples were charged around Rs 30 lakh for the process, purportedly meant for the surrogate. However, the probe revealed that in several cases, the children handed over were not biologically related to the commissioning parents.

'I Love Muhammad' row escalates in UP's Bareilly; over 2 dozen detainedThe controversy began with an FIR in Kanpur on September 9 over banners with the slogan, and has since spread to other states. Political leaders including Asaduddin Owaisi, Tejashwi Yadav and Akhilesh Yadav criticised the government's handling of the issue.

PM Modi's mega digital push: To launch nationwide 4G towers, swadeshi networkPrime Minister Narendra Modi will launch nearly 98,000 new 4G towers and a fully indigenous 4G network today. This move aims to enhance digital access nationwide and position India as a global telecom manufacturing leader.

Abhishek Bachchan trolls Pakistan after Shoaib Akhtar's live TV goofBollywood actor Abhishek Bachchan trolled the Pakistan cricket team after former pacer Shoaib Akhtar mistakenly confused him with Indian opener Abhishek Sharma ahead of the Asia Cup final between India and Pakistan. Notably, India have already defeated Pakistan twice in the ongoing tournament.

Go back to Pakistan: Bangladeshi Diaspora Protests against Yunus outside UNMembers of the Bangladeshi diaspora held a protest outside the United Nations in New York against interim chief adviser Muhammad Yunus, citing increased atrocities on minorities. The demonstration reflected ongoing unrest and deepening divisions following last year's regime change in Bangladesh.

Top court fines Uttarakhand poll body Rs 2 lakh over dual entries in voter listThe Supreme Court imposed a fine of Rs 2 lakh on the Uttarakhand poll panel over its circular allowing candidates with names in multiple voter list to contest panchayat polls.

How a 16-year-old AI prodigy is shaping the future of technologyAt just 16, Raul John Aju has already made a mark as an AI prodigy, founder, and educator. From building robots at the age of 12 to teaching thousands globally, he is shaping the future of artificial intelligence.

Rahul-Tina are still relevant: Rani Mukerji cherishes National Award-win with SRKActor Rani Mukerji appeared at India Today Conclave Mumbai 2025 for the session titled, 'Queen of Reinvention: National Award to Motherhood, Winning it All'. She shared her Rahul Tina moment at the National Award and also spoke about her character in 'Mrs. Chatterjee vs Norway'.

Shehbaz Sharif raises Indus Waters Treaty at UN, no mention of anti-terror effortsPakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif raised strong objections to India's decision to place the Indus Waters Treaty in abeyance while addressing the United Nations General Debate on Friday. He accused India of violating both the provisions of the treaty and international law.

Sonam Wangchuk arrested days after Ladakh violent protest, moved to Jodhpur jailThe government blamed Wangchuk for the unrest, alleging his "provocative statements" and the actions of "politically motivated" groups unhappy with ongoing negotiations between officials and Ladakhi representatives had incited protesters.

Suryakumar Yadav fined over comments in India vs Pak game. BCCI appeals decisionAsia Cup 2025: India captain Suryakumar Yadav was fined 30 percent of his match fee for his comments that alluded to the cross-border hostilities between the two countries during India's group-stage match against Pakistan. Suryakumar had dedicated India's win over Pakistan on September 14 to the victims of the Pahalgam terror attack and the Indian armed forces.

Cricket is confusing! Dasun Shanaka's run-out reversal in Super Over explainedAsia Cup: Dasun Shanaka survived a run-out in the Super Over of the Super 4 clash between India and Sri Lanka, thanks to a quirky cricket rule. The incident sparked confusion and debate over the sport's intricate laws and on-field decisions.

Zohran Mamdani holds commanding lead in NYC mayoral raceDemocratic nominee Zohran Mamdani holds a commanding 20-point lead in the NYC mayoral race, with 45% support, according to a Suffolk University poll. He leads across Black, Hispanic, and Asian voters, and resonates on top issues like affordability, crime, and jobs. Voters have seemingly rejected negative attacks labelling him antisemitic or anti-business.

Pak set to disappoint US, angry Trump post coming soon, ex-Indian diplomat predictsSeconding Ajay Bisaria, another senior Indian diplomat, Jawed Ashraf, said that every new US administration is initially seduced by Pakistan, only to end in disappointment – a pattern seen with Bush, Obama, and now likely to repeat with Trump.

Is Nato chief Mark Rutte following his daddy Trump on India?Nato chief Mark Rutte's remarks on PM Narendra Modi asking Russian President Vladimir Putin to explain his Ukraine plans have been branded "factually incorrect" and "entirely incorrect" by India. Is Rutte following in the footsteps of US President Donald Trump, who he refers to as "daddy"?

Thamma trailer: Ayushmann, Rashmika promise folklore, fear and fun this DiwaliAyushmann Khurrana plays a vampire of sorts in 'Thamma', produced by Dinesh Vijan's Maddock Films. The film is a part of the Indian horror-comedy universe, and also features Rashmika Mandanna and Nawazuddin Siddiqui in lead roles.

'Paaltu chuha' jibe at husband costs woman marriage, divorce upheld by High CourtThe High Court said the wife's conduct of pressuring her husband to abandon his parents and calling him "paaltu chuha" amounted to mental cruelty.

Indian-origin doctor sentenced to 14 years in prison for medical fraud in USIndian-origin doctor Neil K Anand was sentenced to 14 years in prison for health care fraud, illegal opioid distribution, and money laundering. He prescribed 20,000 oxycodone tablets to nine patients and billed insurers for unnecessary drugs to make a profit.

Rajasthan officer caught taking Rs 1,000 bribe in housing scheme, arrestedThe Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB) arrested Ajmer's Village Development Officer Sonakshi Yadav red-handed while accepting a Rs 1,000 bribe under the Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana.

sports.headline: IND vs SL Super Over controversy: Jayasuriya calls for fine-tuning of rules Sri Lanka coach Sanath Jayasuriya has called for fine-tuning of rules, after the Super Over controversy involving Dasun Shanaka during the clash against India on Friday, September 26. Shanaka had his run out reversed due to a loophole in Law 20.1.1.3.

Hardik Pandya injury scare: Will all-rounder be ready for Ind vs Pak final? Asia Cup 2025: Hardik Pandya walked off the field after bowling just one over in Friday's Super Over thriller against Sri Lanka. Bowling coach Morne Morkel stated that a decision on the all-rounder's availability will be made on the eve of the final, following an assessment of his fitness.

India's Super Over epic eats into recovery time ahead of Sunday's Asia Cup final Calling the high-scoring Super Over thriller against Sri Lanka a match that "felt like a final," India captain Suryakumar Yadav said his team would focus on a proper recovery ahead of the big Asia Cup final against Pakistan.

India get a wake-up call, need a Super Over to shake off Sri Lanka Asia Cup 2025, IND vs SL: India extended their winning run in Dubai, but they were tested by Sri Lanka in their final Super 4 match. Pathum Nissanka's 107 went in vain as Sri Lanka tied with India before losing the Super Over on Friday, September 26.

Dasun Shanaka's run-out reversal in Super Over explained Asia Cup: Dasun Shanaka survived a run-out in the Super Over of the Super 4 clash between India and Sri Lanka, thanks to a quirky cricket rule. The incident sparked confusion and debate over the sport's intricate laws and on-field decisions.

Nissanka emulates Virat Kohli, becomes 3rd batter to hit Asia Cup T20 hundred Pathum Nissanka etched his name into the record books on Thursday as he struck his maiden T20I hundred, becoming the first-ever Sri Lankan batter to score a century in the format against India.

Notably, India have already defeated Pakistan twice in the ongoing tournament.

Abhishek Sharma scripts Asia Cup history, breaks Mohammad Rizwan's record Asia Cup 2025: India opener Abhishek Sharma became the first batter in the history of the tournament to go past 300 runs in a single edition in T20I format. Abhishek smashed 61 from 31 balls in Dubai on Friday, September 26.

India's MVP to non-performing asset: Fans slam Suryakumar after another failure India captain Suryakumar Yadav once again failed to make an impact with the bat in his latest outing against Sri Lanka, drawing criticism from fans over his disappointing run in the Asia Cup.

The way cricketers push themselves inspired me: Usain Bolt Legendary sprinter Usain Bolt revealed that watching gifted cricketers give their all on the field inspired him to push his limits and strive for excellence on the track.

Abhishek Bachchan trolls Pakistan after Shoaib Akhtar's live TV goof Bollywood actor Abhishek Bachchan trolled the Pakistan cricket team after former pacer Shoaib Akhtar mistakenly confused him with Indian opener Abhishek Sharma ahead of the Asia Cup final between India and Pakistan. Notably, India have already defeated Pakistan twice in the ongoing tournament.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
